column2: Having selected an educational institution, the next requisite is a suitable equipment.

column2: I would, therefore, recommend the following list, subject, of course, to variation in individual cases.

column2: After the purchase of a complete outfit, it will be necessary to say goodbye to one's local friends.
column3: After the purchase of a complete outfit, it will be necessary to say goodbye to one's local friends.

column2: Partings are always somewhat sad, but it will be found that much simple pleasure may be derived from the last nights with the various boys to whom one is engaged.
column3: Partings are always somewhat sad, but it will be found that much simple pleasure may be derived from the last nights with the various boys to whom one is engaged.

column2: In this connection, however, it would be well to avoid making any rash statements regarding undying friendship and affection, because, when you next see Eddie or Walter, at Christmas time, you will have been three months in the East, while they have been at the State University, and really, after one starts dancing with Yale men--well, it's a funny world.

column2: If you are compelled to go to the dining car alone, you will probably sit beside an Elk with white socks, who will call the waiter "George." Along about the second course he will say to you, "It's warm for September, isn't it?" to which you should answer "No." That will dispose of the Elk.
column3: If you are compelled to go to the dining car alone, you will probably sit beside an Elk with white socks, who will call the waiter "George." Along about the second course he will say to you, "It's warm for September, isn't it?" to which you should answer "no" That will dispose of the Elk.

column2: Across the table from you will be a Grand Army man and his wife, going to visit their boy Elmer's wife's folks in Schenectady.

column2: When the fish is served, the Grand Army man will choke on a bone.
column3: When the fish is served, the Grand Army man will choke on a bone.

column2: Let him choke, but do not be too hopeful, as the chances are that he will dislodge the bone. All will go well until the dessert, when his wife will begin telling how raspberry sherbet always disagrees with her.
column3: Let him choke, but do not be too hopeful, as the chances are that he will dislodge the bone. All will go well until the dessert, when his wife will begin telling how raspberry sherbet always disagrees with her.

column2: It will also be found that the light in your berth does not work, so you will be awake for a long time; finally, just as you are leaving Buffalo, you will at last get to sleep, and when you open your eyes again, you will be--in Buffalo.

column2: THE FIRST DAYS IN THE NEW SCHOOL
column3: THE FIRST DAYS IN THE NEW SCHOOL

column2: The first week of school life is apt to be quite discouraging, and we can not too emphatically warn the young girl not to do anything rash under the influence of homesickness.
column3: The first week of school life is apt to be quite discouraging, and we can not too emphatically warn the young girl not to do anything rash under the influence of homesickness.

column2: We advise: Go slow at first.
column3: We advise: Go slow at first.

column2: In your first day at school you will be shown your room; in your room you will find a sad-eyed fat girl.
column3: In your first day at school you will be shown your room; in your room you will find a sad eyed fat girl.

column2: You will find that you have drawn a blank, that she comes from Topeka, Kan., that her paw made his money in oil, and that she is religious.
column3: You will find that you have drawn a blank, that she comes from Topeka, Kan., that her paw made his money in oil, and that she is religious.

column2: You will be nice to her for the first week, because you aren't taking any chances at the start; you will tolerate her for the rest of the year, because she will do your lessons for you every night.
column3: You will be nice to her for the first week, because you aren't taking any chances at the start; you will tolerate her for the rest of the year, because she will do your lessons for you every night.

column2: Across the hall from you there will be two older girls who are back for their second year.
column3: Across the hall from you there will be two older girls who are back for their second year.

column2: One of them will remind you of the angel painted on the ceiling of the Victory Theatre back home, until she starts telling about her summer at Narragansett; from the other you will learn how to inhale.
